content.description: Start sitting/crouched with left hand on a quartz sloper and right hand on a quartz sidepull in the seam. Take on the tough opening moves up the seam to get established on a decent edge up and left. Find one more right hand before launching for the lip.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter. Flat landing.
content.location: Center of the steep downhill face in an obvious seam/pod.

content.description: Stand start on the pedestal in the center of the slabby side of the boulder. Work the slab straight up via crimps and sidepulls.
content.location: Center of the downhill slabby side.

content.description: Start matched on the bread loaf (sea cucumber) shaped hold with feet out right. Move left low to the ground and then straight up through the crack feature.
content.location: A few feet left of "Takin' on the Jellies." Look for the prominent bread loaf feature.

content.description: One of the closest boulders to the end of the approach to Grizzly Heights. Currently holds a V6, but has potential for several more routes. Great views of Turtle Dome across the valley and the sea turtle looking formation in front of this boulder.
